title: Enacts the military spouse act of 2011
summary: Enacts the military spouse act of 2011, which: requires a workshop to investigate and report about licensing and the difficulties encountered by military spouses (Part A); authorizes the state to certify persons to teach who are not graduates of teacher education programs (Part B); adopts the interstate nursing licensure compact (Part C); and authorizes licensing of military spouses with out-of-state licenses in equivalent occupations (Part D).
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1332

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A. CASTELLI, MONTESANO, BURLING, ORTIZ -- Multi-
         Sponsored by -- M. of A.  CALHOUN -- read once  and  referred  to  the
         Committee on Higher Education

       AN  ACT to require a workgroup to investigate and report about licensing
         and the difficulties encountered by  military  spouses  (Part  A);  to
         amend  the education law, in relation to the authority of the state to
         certify persons to teach who are not graduates  of  teacher  education
         programs (Part B); to amend the education law, in relation to adopting
         the interstate nursing licensure compact (Part C); to amend the educa-
         tion  law,  the  general  business law, the insurance law and the real
         property law, in relation to licensing of military spouses  with  out-
         of-state licenses in equivalent occupations (Part D)

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. This act enacts into law components of legislation relating
    2  to the "Military Spouse Act of 2011". Each component is wholly contained
    3  within a Part identified as Parts A through D. The  effective  date  for
    4  each particular provision contained within such Part is set forth in the
    5  last section of such Part. Any provision in any section contained within
    6  a  Part, including the effective date of the Part, which makes reference
    7  to a section "of this act", when used in connection with that particular
    8  component, shall be deemed  to  mean  and  refer  to  the  corresponding
    9  section  of  the  Part  in which it is found.  Section three of this act
   10  sets forth the general effective date of this act.

   11                                   PART A

   12    Section 1. State agencies are  hereby  directed  to  help  spouses  of
   13  members  of  the  armed  forces  of the United States, national guard or

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD05512-01-1

       A. 1332                             2

    1  reserves transfer teaching certificates or  professional  certifications
    2  to their new home state.
    3    S  2.  The  department  of labor and the division of veterans' affairs
    4  shall establish a workgroup to identify licensing requirements for work-
    5  force shortage areas and to study,  in  conjunction  with  the  relevant
    6  licensing  entities,  whether comparable military training could substi-
    7  tute for current licensing requirements,  and  manners  in  which  state
    8  agencies,  regulatory bodies and licensing entities can adopt procedures
    9  sensitive to the difficulties encountered by military spouses. The work-
   10  group shall submit  any  findings,  including  any  recommendations  for
   11  legislative  action  to  the  governor,  the  temporary president of the
   12  senate and the speaker of the assembly by January 1, 2013.
   13    S 3. This act shall take effect immediately.

   14                                   PART B

   15    Section 1. Subdivision 1 of section  3006  of  the  education  law  is
   16  amended by adding a new paragraph f to read as follows:
   17    F. AN ALTERNATIVE PLACEMENT CERTIFICATE TO ANY PERSON:
   18    (1)  WHO MEETS THE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS OF THE TROOPS FOR TEACHERS
   19  PROGRAM OPERATED BY THE UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE AND  MANAGED
   20  BY  THE DEFENSE ACTIVITY FOR NON-TRADITIONAL EDUCATION SUPPORT ORGANIZA-
   21  TION; AND
   22    (2) WHO MEETS THE REQUIREMENTS SET FORTH  IN  SECTION  THREE  THOUSAND
   23  EIGHT-A OF THIS ARTICLE.
   24    S  2.  The  education law is amended by adding a new section 3008-a to
   25  read as follows:
   26    S 3008-A. ALTERNATIVE  TEACHING  CERTIFICATION.  1.  THE  COMMISSIONER
   27  SHALL  ISSUE A ONE-YEAR, NONRENEWABLE MIDDLE OR SECONDARY LEVEL ALTERNA-
   28  TIVE TEACHING CERTIFICATION TO TEACH TO  ANY  PERSON  WHO  HAS  ATTAINED
   29  CERTIFICATION  BY  AN  ALTERNATIVE TEACHER CERTIFICATION ORGANIZATION AS
   30  SET FORTH IN SUBDIVISION THREE OF THIS SECTION AND HAS MET THE  REQUIRE-
   31  MENTS OF SECTION THREE THOUSAND FOUR-B OF THIS ARTICLE.
   32    2.  NOTWITHSTANDING  ANY  PROVISION  OF  LAW TO THE CONTRARY, TEACHERS
   33  ISSUED AN ALTERNATIVE TEACHING CERTIFICATION PURSUANT  TO  THIS  SECTION
   34  SHALL  PARTICIPATE  IN THE MENTORING PROGRAM PROVIDED BY THE ALTERNATIVE
   35  TEACHER CERTIFICATION ORGANIZATION AS SET FORTH IN SUBDIVISION THREE  OF
   36  THIS  SECTION.  UPON  SUCCESSFUL  COMPLETION  OF SUCH MENTORING PROGRAM,
   37  COMPLETION OF THE APPLICATION AND PAYMENT OF THE  CERTIFICATION  FEE  AS
   38  SET FORTH IN SECTION THREE THOUSAND SIX OF THIS ARTICLE OR AS PRESCRIBED
   39  BY  THE COMMISSIONER, THE COMMISSIONER SHALL ISSUE THE TEACHER A CERTIF-
   40  ICATE TO TEACH.
   41    3. FOR PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION, THE COMMISSIONER  SHALL  IDENTIFY  AN
   42  ALTERNATIVE  TEACHER  CERTIFICATION  ORGANIZATION  THAT WAS FOUNDED WITH
   43  GRANT FUNDING FROM THE UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF  EDUCATION  AND  THAT
   44  DEVELOPED  PURSUANT  TO THE PASSPORT TO TEACHING PROGRAM ADMINISTERED BY
   45  THE AMERICAN BOARD FOR CERTIFICATION OF TEACHER EXCELLENCE.  THE  ORGAN-
   46  IZATION  SHALL  REQUIRE  CANDIDATES  TO HOLD A BACHELOR'S DEGREE, PASS A
   47  PROFESSIONAL TEACHING KNOWLEDGE EXAM, PASS A SUBJECT AREA EXAM AND  PASS
   48  A  BACKGROUND  CHECK.  THE  ORGANIZATION  SHALL  PROVIDE CANDIDATES WITH
   49  ACCESS TO WORKSHOPS, AN EXPERIENCED TEACHER-ADVISOR AND OPTIONAL  ACCESS
   50  TO  COMPREHENSIVE  SUBJECT  MATTER  REFRESHER  COURSES. THE ORGANIZATION
   51  SHALL ALSO PROVIDE AN INTENSIVE MENTORING AND INDUCTION PROGRAM.
   52    S 3. This act shall take effect on the ninetieth day  after  it  shall
   53  have  become  a  law; provided, however, that effective immediately, the
   54  addition, amendment and/or repeal of any rule  or  regulation  necessary

       A. 1332                             3

    1  for  the implementation of this act on its effective date are authorized
    2  and directed to be made and completed on or before such effective date.

    3                                   PART C

    4    Section  1.  The education law is amended by adding a new section 6911
    5  to read as follows:
    6    S 6911. INTERSTATE NURSE LICENSURE COMPACT. 1.  THE  INTERSTATE  NURSE
    7  LICENSURE  COMPACT  IS HEREBY ENACTED INTO LAW AND ENTERED INTO WITH ALL
    8  JURISDICTIONS LEGALLY JOINING  THEREIN  IN  THE  FORM  SUBSTANTIALLY  AS
    9  FOLLOWS:

   10                     INTERSTATE NURSE LICENSURE COMPACT
   11                                 ARTICLE I.
   12                     FINDINGS AND DECLARATION OF PURPOSE

   13    (A) THE PARTY STATES FIND THAT:
   14    (1)  THE HEALTH AND SAFETY OF THE PUBLIC ARE AFFECTED BY THE DEGREE OF
   15  COMPLIANCE WITH AND THE EFFECTIVENESS OF ENFORCEMENT ACTIVITIES  RELATED
   16  TO STATE NURSE LICENSURE LAWS;
   17    (2)  VIOLATIONS OF NURSE LICENSURE AND OTHER LAWS REGULATING THE PRAC-
   18  TICE OF NURSING MAY RESULT IN INJURY OR HARM TO THE PUBLIC;
   19    (3) THE EXPANDED MOBILITY OF NURSES AND THE USE OF  ADVANCED  COMMUNI-
   20  CATION  TECHNOLOGIES  AS PART OF OUR NATION'S HEALTHCARE DELIVERY SYSTEM
   21  REQUIRE GREATER COORDINATION AND COOPERATION AMONG STATES IN  THE  AREAS
   22  OF NURSE LICENSURE AND REGULATION;
   23    (4)  NEW PRACTICE MODALITIES AND TECHNOLOGY MAKE COMPLIANCE WITH INDI-
   24  VIDUAL STATE NURSE LICENSURE LAWS DIFFICULT AND COMPLEX; AND
   25    (5) THE CURRENT SYSTEM OF DUPLICATIVE LICENSURE FOR NURSES  PRACTICING
   26  IN  MULTIPLE  STATES  IS  CUMBERSOME  AND  REDUNDANT  TO BOTH NURSES AND
   27  STATES.
   28    (B) THE GENERAL PURPOSES OF THIS COMPACT ARE TO:
   29    (1) FACILITATE THE STATES'  RESPONSIBILITY  TO  PROTECT  THE  PUBLIC'S
   30  HEALTH AND SAFETY;
   31    (2)  ENSURE AND ENCOURAGE THE COOPERATION OF PARTY STATES IN THE AREAS
   32  OF NURSE LICENSURE AND REGULATION;
   33    (3) FACILITATE THE EXCHANGE OF INFORMATION BETWEEN PARTY STATES IN THE
   34  AREAS OF NURSE REGULATION, INVESTIGATION, AND ADVERSE ACTIONS;
   35    (4) PROMOTE COMPLIANCE WITH THE LAWS GOVERNING THE PRACTICE OF NURSING
   36  IN EACH JURISDICTION; AND
   37    (5) INVEST ALL PARTY  STATES  WITH  THE  AUTHORITY  TO  HOLD  A  NURSE
   38  ACCOUNTABLE  FOR  MEETING  ALL STATE PRACTICE LAWS IN THE STATE IN WHICH
   39  THE PATIENT IS LOCATED AT THE TIME CARE IS RENDERED THROUGH  THE  MUTUAL
   40  RECOGNITION OF PARTY STATE LICENSES.

   41                                 ARTICLE II.
   42                                 DEFINITIONS

   43    AS USED IN THIS COMPACT:
   44    (A) "ADVERSE ACTION" MEANS A HOME OR REMOTE STATE ACTION.
   45    (B) "ALTERNATIVE PROGRAM" MEANS A VOLUNTARY, NON-DISCIPLINARY MONITOR-
   46  ING PROGRAM APPROVED BY A NURSE LICENSING BOARD.
   47    (C)  "COORDINATED  LICENSURE  INFORMATION  SYSTEM" MEANS AN INTEGRATED
   48  PROCESS FOR COLLECTING, STORING, AND SHARING INFORMATION ON NURSE LICEN-
   49  SURE AND ENFORCEMENT ACTIVITIES RELATED TO NURSE LICENSURE  LAWS,  WHICH

       A. 1332                             4

    1  IS  ADMINISTERED BY A NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION COMPOSED OF AND CONTROLLED
    2  BY STATE NURSE LICENSING BOARDS.
    3    (D) "CURRENT SIGNIFICANT INVESTIGATIVE INFORMATION" MEANS:
    4    (1) INVESTIGATIVE INFORMATION THAT A LICENSING BOARD, AFTER A PRELIMI-
    5  NARY INQUIRY THAT INCLUDES NOTIFICATION AND AN OPPORTUNITY FOR THE NURSE
    6  TO  RESPOND  IF  REQUIRED  BY  STATE  LAW,  HAS REASON TO BELIEVE IS NOT
    7  GROUNDLESS AND, IF PROVED TRUE, WOULD INDICATE MORE THAN A MINOR INFRAC-
    8  TION; OR
    9    (2) INVESTIGATIVE INFORMATION THAT INDICATES THAT THE NURSE REPRESENTS
   10  AN IMMEDIATE THREAT TO PUBLIC HEALTH AND SAFETY  REGARDLESS  OF  WHETHER
   11  THE NURSE HAS BEEN NOTIFIED AND HAD AN OPPORTUNITY TO RESPOND.
   12    (E)  "HOME  STATE"  MEANS THE PARTY STATE WHICH IS THE NURSE'S PRIMARY
   13  STATE OF RESIDENCE.
   14    (F) "HOME STATE ACTION" MEANS ANY ADMINISTRATIVE, CIVIL, EQUITABLE  OR
   15  CRIMINAL  ACTION PERMITTED BY THE HOME STATE'S LAWS WHICH ARE IMPOSED ON
   16  A NURSE BY THE HOME STATE'S LICENSING BOARD OR OTHER AUTHORITY INCLUDING
   17  ACTIONS AGAINST AN INDIVIDUAL'S LICENSE SUCH AS: REVOCATION, SUSPENSION,
   18  PROBATION OR ANY OTHER ACTION WHICH AFFECTS THE NURSE'S AUTHORIZATION TO
   19  PRACTICE.
   20    (G) "LICENSING BOARD" MEANS A PARTY STATE'S REGULATORY BODY  RESPONSI-
   21  BLE FOR ISSUING NURSE LICENSES.
   22    (H) "MULTISTATE LICENSURE PRIVILEGE" MEANS CURRENT, OFFICIAL AUTHORITY
   23  FROM  A  REMOTE  STATE  PERMITTING  THE  PRACTICE OF NURSING AS EITHER A
   24  REGISTERED NURSE OR A LICENSED PRACTICAL/VOCATIONAL NURSE IN SUCH  PARTY
   25  STATE.  ALL PARTY STATES HAVE THE AUTHORITY, IN ACCORDANCE WITH EXISTING
   26  STATE DUE PROCESS LAW, TO TAKE ACTIONS  AGAINST  THE  NURSE'S  PRIVILEGE
   27  SUCH  AS:  REVOCATION,  SUSPENSION,  PROBATION OR ANY OTHER ACTION WHICH
   28  AFFECTS A NURSE'S AUTHORIZATION TO PRACTICE.
   29    (I) "NURSE" MEANS A REGISTERED NURSE OR LICENSED  PRACTICAL/VOCATIONAL
   30  NURSE, AS THOSE TERMS ARE DEFINED BY EACH PARTY'S STATE PRACTICE LAWS.
   31    (J) "PARTY STATE" MEANS ANY STATE THAT HAS ADOPTED THIS COMPACT.
   32    (K) "REMOTE STATE" MEANS A PARTY STATE, OTHER THAN THE HOME STATE,
   33    (1) WHERE THE PATIENT IS LOCATED AT THE TIME NURSING CARE IS PROVIDED,
   34  OR
   35    (2) IN THE CASE OF THE PRACTICE OF NURSING NOT INVOLVING A PATIENT, IN
   36  SUCH PARTY STATE WHERE THE RECIPIENT OF NURSING PRACTICE IS LOCATED.
   37    (L) "REMOTE STATE ACTION" MEANS
   38    (1)  ANY ADMINISTRATIVE, CIVIL, EQUITABLE OR CRIMINAL ACTION PERMITTED
   39  BY A REMOTE STATE'S LAWS WHICH ARE IMPOSED ON  A  NURSE  BY  THE  REMOTE
   40  STATE'S  LICENSING BOARD OR OTHER AUTHORITY INCLUDING ACTIONS AGAINST AN
   41  INDIVIDUAL'S MULTISTATE LICENSURE PRIVILEGE TO PRACTICE  IN  THE  REMOTE
   42  STATE, AND
   43    (2)  CEASE  AND DESIST AND OTHER INJUNCTIVE OR EQUITABLE ORDERS ISSUED
   44  BY REMOTE STATES OR THE LICENSING BOARDS THEREOF.
   45    (M) "STATE" MEANS A STATE,  TERRITORY  OR  POSSESSION  OF  THE  UNITED
   46  STATES, THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA OR THE COMMONWEALTH OF PUERTO RICO.
   47    (N)  "STATE  PRACTICE  LAWS" MEANS THOSE INDIVIDUAL PARTY STATE'S LAWS
   48  AND REGULATIONS THAT GOVERN THE PRACTICE OF NURSING, DEFINE THE SCOPE OF
   49  NURSING PRACTICE, AND CREATE THE METHODS AND GROUNDS FOR IMPOSING DISCI-
   50  PLINE. "STATE PRACTICE LAWS" DOES NOT INCLUDE THE INITIAL QUALIFICATIONS
   51  FOR LICENSURE OR REQUIREMENTS NECESSARY TO OBTAIN AND RETAIN A  LICENSE,
   52  EXCEPT FOR QUALIFICATIONS OR REQUIREMENTS OF THE HOME STATE.

   53                                ARTICLE III.
   54                     GENERAL PROVISIONS AND JURISDICTION

       A. 1332                             5

    1    (A) A LICENSE TO PRACTICE REGISTERED NURSING ISSUED BY A HOME STATE TO
    2  A  RESIDENT  IN  THAT  STATE  WILL  BE RECOGNIZED BY EACH PARTY STATE AS
    3  AUTHORIZING A MULTISTATE LICENSURE PRIVILEGE TO PRACTICE AS A REGISTERED
    4  NURSE  IN  SUCH  PARTY   STATE.   A   LICENSE   TO   PRACTICE   LICENSED
    5  PRACTICAL/VOCATIONAL  NURSING  ISSUED  BY  A HOME STATE TO A RESIDENT IN
    6  THAT STATE WILL BE RECOGNIZED BY  EACH  PARTY  STATE  AS  AUTHORIZING  A
    7  MULTISTATE    LICENSURE    PRIVILEGE   TO   PRACTICE   AS   A   LICENSED
    8  PRACTICAL/VOCATIONAL NURSE IN SUCH PARTY STATE. IN ORDER  TO  OBTAIN  OR
    9  RETAIN A LICENSE, AN APPLICANT MUST MEET THE HOME STATE'S QUALIFICATIONS
   10  FOR  LICENSURE AND LICENSE RENEWAL AS WELL AS ALL OTHER APPLICABLE STATE
   11  LAWS.
   12    (B) PARTY STATES MAY, IN ACCORDANCE WITH STATE DUE PROCESS LAWS, LIMIT
   13  OR REVOKE THE MULTISTATE LICENSURE PRIVILEGE OF ANY NURSE TO PRACTICE IN
   14  THEIR STATE AND MAY TAKE ANY OTHER ACTIONS UNDER THEIR APPLICABLE  STATE
   15  LAWS  NECESSARY TO PROTECT THE HEALTH AND SAFETY OF THEIR CITIZENS. IF A
   16  PARTY STATE TAKES SUCH ACTION, IT SHALL PROMPTLY NOTIFY THE  ADMINISTRA-
   17  TOR  OF THE COORDINATED LICENSURE INFORMATION SYSTEM.  THE ADMINISTRATOR
   18  OF THE COORDINATED LICENSURE INFORMATION SYSTEM  SHALL  PROMPTLY  NOTIFY
   19  THE HOME STATE OF ANY SUCH ACTIONS BY REMOTE STATES.
   20    (C) EVERY NURSE PRACTICING IN A PARTY STATE MUST COMPLY WITH THE STATE
   21  PRACTICE  LAWS  OF THE STATE IN WHICH THE PATIENT IS LOCATED AT THE TIME
   22  CARE IS RENDERED.  IN ADDITION, THE PRACTICE OF NURSING IS  NOT  LIMITED
   23  TO  PATIENT  CARE,  BUT SHALL INCLUDE ALL NURSING PRACTICE AS DEFINED BY
   24  THE STATE PRACTICE LAWS OF A PARTY STATE. THE PRACTICE OF  NURSING  WILL
   25  SUBJECT A NURSE TO THE JURISDICTION OF THE NURSE LICENSING BOARD AND THE
   26  COURTS, AS WELL AS THE LAWS, IN THAT PARTY STATE.
   27    (D)  THIS  COMPACT  DOES NOT AFFECT ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS IMPOSED BY
   28  STATES FOR ADVANCED PRACTICE REGISTERED NURSING. HOWEVER,  A  MULTISTATE
   29  LICENSURE  PRIVILEGE  TO  PRACTICE REGISTERED NURSING GRANTED BY A PARTY
   30  STATE SHALL BE RECOGNIZED BY OTHER PARTY STATES AS A LICENSE TO PRACTICE
   31  REGISTERED NURSING IF ONE IS REQUIRED BY STATE LAW AS A PRECONDITION FOR
   32  QUALIFYING FOR ADVANCED PRACTICE REGISTERED NURSE AUTHORIZATION.
   33    (E) INDIVIDUALS NOT RESIDING IN A PARTY STATE  SHALL  CONTINUE  TO  BE
   34  ABLE TO APPLY FOR NURSE LICENSURE AS PROVIDED FOR UNDER THE LAWS OF EACH
   35  PARTY  STATE. HOWEVER, THE LICENSE GRANTED TO THESE INDIVIDUALS WILL NOT
   36  BE RECOGNIZED AS GRANTING THE PRIVILEGE TO PRACTICE NURSING IN ANY OTHER
   37  PARTY STATE UNLESS EXPLICITLY AGREED TO BY THAT PARTY STATE.

   38                                 ARTICLE IV.
   39                 APPLICATIONS FOR LICENSURE IN A PARTY STATE

   40    (A) UPON APPLICATION FOR A LICENSE, THE LICENSING  BOARD  IN  A  PARTY
   41  STATE  SHALL  ASCERTAIN,  THROUGH  THE COORDINATED LICENSURE INFORMATION
   42  SYSTEM, WHETHER THE APPLICANT HAS EVER HELD, OR  IS  THE  HOLDER  OF,  A
   43  LICENSE ISSUED BY ANY OTHER STATE, WHETHER THERE ARE ANY RESTRICTIONS ON
   44  THE MULTISTATE LICENSURE PRIVILEGE, AND WHETHER ANY OTHER ADVERSE ACTION
   45  BY ANY STATE HAS BEEN TAKEN AGAINST THE LICENSE.
   46    (B)  A  NURSE  IN A PARTY STATE SHALL HOLD LICENSURE IN ONLY ONE PARTY
   47  STATE AT A TIME ISSUED BY THE HOME STATE.
   48    (C) A NURSE WHO INTENDS TO CHANGE PRIMARY STATE OF RESIDENCE MAY APPLY
   49  FOR LICENSURE IN THE NEW HOME STATE IN ADVANCE OF SUCH CHANGE.  HOWEVER,
   50  NEW  LICENSES  WILL  NOT  BE ISSUED BY A PARTY STATE UNTIL AFTER A NURSE
   51  PROVIDES EVIDENCE OF CHANGE IN PRIMARY STATE OF  RESIDENCE  SATISFACTORY
   52  TO THE NEW HOME STATE'S LICENSING BOARD.
   53    (D) WHEN A NURSE CHANGES PRIMARY STATE OF RESIDENCE BY:

       A. 1332                             6

    1    (1)  MOVING  BETWEEN  TWO PARTY STATES, AND OBTAINS A LICENSE FROM THE
    2  NEW HOME STATE, THE LICENSE FROM THE FORMER  HOME  STATE  IS  NO  LONGER
    3  VALID;
    4    (2)  MOVING  FROM  A  NON-PARTY  STATE TO A PARTY STATE, AND OBTAINS A
    5  LICENSE FROM THE NEW HOME STATE, THE INDIVIDUAL STATE LICENSE ISSUED  BY
    6  THE  NON-PARTY STATE IS NOT AFFECTED AND WILL REMAIN IN FULL FORCE IF SO
    7  PROVIDED BY THE LAWS OF THE NON-PARTY STATE;
    8    (3) MOVING FROM A PARTY STATE TO A NON-PARTY STATE, THE LICENSE ISSUED
    9  BY THE PRIOR HOME STATE CONVERTS TO AN INDIVIDUAL STATE  LICENSE,  VALID
   10  ONLY  IN  THE FORMER HOME STATE, WITHOUT THE MULTISTATE LICENSURE PRIVI-
   11  LEGE TO PRACTICE IN OTHER PARTY STATES.

   12                                 ARTICLE V.
   13                               ADVERSE ACTIONS

   14    IN ADDITION TO THE GENERAL PROVISIONS DESCRIBED IN  ARTICLE  III,  THE
   15  FOLLOWING PROVISIONS APPLY:
   16    (A) THE LICENSING BOARD OF A REMOTE STATE SHALL PROMPTLY REPORT TO THE
   17  ADMINISTRATOR OF THE COORDINATED LICENSURE INFORMATION SYSTEM ANY REMOTE
   18  STATE  ACTIONS INCLUDING THE FACTUAL AND LEGAL BASIS FOR SUCH ACTION, IF
   19  KNOWN. THE LICENSING BOARD OF A REMOTE STATE SHALL ALSO PROMPTLY  REPORT
   20  ANY  SIGNIFICANT  CURRENT  INVESTIGATIVE  INFORMATION YET TO RESULT IN A
   21  REMOTE STATE ACTION. THE  ADMINISTRATOR  OF  THE  COORDINATED  LICENSURE
   22  INFORMATION  SYSTEM  SHALL  PROMPTLY  NOTIFY  THE HOME STATE OF ANY SUCH
   23  REPORTS.
   24    (B) THE LICENSING BOARD OF A PARTY STATE SHALL HAVE THE  AUTHORITY  TO
   25  COMPLETE  ANY  PENDING  INVESTIGATIONS  FOR  A NURSE WHO CHANGES PRIMARY
   26  STATE OF RESIDENCE DURING THE COURSE OF SUCH  INVESTIGATIONS.  IT  SHALL
   27  ALSO HAVE THE AUTHORITY TO TAKE APPROPRIATE ACTION OR ACTIONS, AND SHALL
   28  PROMPTLY  REPORT  THE CONCLUSIONS OF SUCH INVESTIGATIONS TO THE ADMINIS-
   29  TRATOR OF THE COORDINATED LICENSURE INFORMATION SYSTEM.  THE ADMINISTRA-
   30  TOR OF THE COORDINATED LICENSURE INFORMATION SYSTEM SHALL PROMPTLY NOTI-
   31  FY THE NEW HOME STATE OF ANY SUCH ACTIONS.
   32    (C) A REMOTE STATE MAY TAKE ADVERSE ACTION  AFFECTING  THE  MULTISTATE
   33  LICENSURE  PRIVILEGE  TO PRACTICE WITHIN THAT PARTY STATE. HOWEVER, ONLY
   34  THE HOME STATE SHALL HAVE THE POWER TO IMPOSE ADVERSE ACTION AGAINST THE
   35  LICENSE ISSUED BY THE HOME STATE.
   36    (D) FOR PURPOSES OF IMPOSING ADVERSE ACTION, THE  LICENSING  BOARD  OF
   37  THE  HOME  STATE  SHALL  GIVE  THE  SAME PRIORITY AND EFFECT TO REPORTED
   38  CONDUCT RECEIVED FROM A REMOTE STATE AS IT WOULD  IF  SUCH  CONDUCT  HAD
   39  OCCURRED  WITHIN  THE  HOME  STATE.  IN SO DOING, IT SHALL APPLY ITS OWN
   40  STATE LAWS TO DETERMINE APPROPRIATE ACTION.
   41    (E) THE HOME STATE MAY TAKE ADVERSE ACTION BASED ON THE FACTUAL  FIND-
   42  INGS  OF  THE REMOTE STATE, SO LONG AS EACH STATE FOLLOWS ITS OWN PROCE-
   43  DURES FOR IMPOSING SUCH ADVERSE ACTION.
   44    (F) NOTHING IN THIS COMPACT SHALL OVERRIDE A  PARTY  STATE'S  DECISION
   45  THAT  PARTICIPATION  IN  AN  ALTERNATIVE  PROGRAM MAY BE USED IN LIEU OF
   46  LICENSURE ACTION AND THAT SUCH PARTICIPATION SHALL REMAIN NON-PUBLIC  IF
   47  REQUIRED  BY  THE  PARTY STATE'S LAWS.  PARTY STATES MUST REQUIRE NURSES
   48  WHO ENTER ANY ALTERNATIVE PROGRAMS TO AGREE NOT TO PRACTICE IN ANY OTHER
   49  PARTY STATE DURING THE TERM OF THE  ALTERNATIVE  PROGRAM  WITHOUT  PRIOR
   50  AUTHORIZATION FROM SUCH OTHER PARTY STATE.

   51                                 ARTICLE VI.
   52    ADDITIONAL AUTHORITIES INVESTED IN PARTY STATE NURSE LICENSING BOARDS

       A. 1332                             7

    1    NOTWITHSTANDING  ANY  OTHER POWERS, PARTY STATE NURSE LICENSING BOARDS
    2  SHALL HAVE THE AUTHORITY TO:
    3    (A)  IF  OTHERWISE  PERMITTED  BY STATE LAW, RECOVER FROM THE AFFECTED
    4  NURSE THE COSTS OF INVESTIGATIONS AND  DISPOSITION  OF  CASES  RESULTING
    5  FROM ANY ADVERSE ACTION TAKEN AGAINST THAT NURSE;
    6    (B) ISSUE SUBPOENAS FOR BOTH HEARINGS AND INVESTIGATIONS WHICH REQUIRE
    7  THE  ATTENDANCE  AND  TESTIMONY  OF  WITNESSES,  AND  THE  PRODUCTION OF
    8  EVIDENCE.  SUBPOENAS ISSUED BY A NURSE LICENSING BOARD IN A PARTY  STATE
    9  FOR  THE ATTENDANCE AND TESTIMONY OF WITNESSES, AND/OR THE PRODUCTION OF
   10  EVIDENCE FROM ANOTHER PARTY STATE, SHALL BE ENFORCED IN THE LATTER STATE
   11  BY ANY COURT OF COMPETENT JURISDICTION, ACCORDING TO  THE  PRACTICE  AND
   12  PROCEDURE  OF  THAT  COURT APPLICABLE TO SUBPOENAS ISSUED IN PROCEEDINGS
   13  PENDING BEFORE IT. THE ISSUING AUTHORITY SHALL  PAY  ANY  WITNESS  FEES,
   14  TRAVEL EXPENSES, MILEAGE AND OTHER FEES REQUIRED BY THE SERVICE STATUTES
   15  OF THE STATE WHERE THE WITNESSES AND/OR EVIDENCE ARE LOCATED.
   16    (C) ISSUE CEASE AND DESIST ORDERS TO LIMIT OR REVOKE A NURSE'S AUTHOR-
   17  ITY TO PRACTICE IN THEIR STATE;
   18    (D)  PROMULGATE UNIFORM RULES AND REGULATIONS AS PROVIDED FOR IN ARTI-
   19  CLE VIII(C).

   20                                ARTICLE VII.
   21                  COORDINATED LICENSURE INFORMATION SYSTEM

   22    (A) ALL PARTY STATES SHALL PARTICIPATE  IN  A  COOPERATIVE  EFFORT  TO
   23  CREATE  A  COORDINATED  DATA  BASE OF ALL LICENSED REGISTERED NURSES AND
   24  LICENSED PRACTICAL/VOCATIONAL NURSES. THIS SYSTEM SHALL INCLUDE INFORMA-
   25  TION ON THE  LICENSURE  AND  DISCIPLINARY  HISTORY  OF  EACH  NURSE,  AS
   26  CONTRIBUTED  BY  PARTY  STATES,  TO  ASSIST IN THE COORDINATION OF NURSE
   27  LICENSURE AND ENFORCEMENT EFFORTS.
   28    (B) NOTWITHSTANDING ANY OTHER PROVISION  OF  LAW,  ALL  PARTY  STATES'
   29  LICENSING  BOARDS SHALL PROMPTLY REPORT ADVERSE ACTIONS, ACTIONS AGAINST
   30  MULTISTATE LICENSURE PRIVILEGES, ANY CURRENT  SIGNIFICANT  INVESTIGATIVE
   31  INFORMATION  YET  TO  RESULT IN ADVERSE ACTION, DENIALS OF APPLICATIONS,
   32  AND THE REASONS FOR SUCH DENIALS, TO THE COORDINATED LICENSURE  INFORMA-
   33  TION SYSTEM.
   34    (C) CURRENT SIGNIFICANT INVESTIGATIVE INFORMATION SHALL BE TRANSMITTED
   35  THROUGH THE COORDINATED LICENSURE INFORMATION SYSTEM ONLY TO PARTY STATE
   36  LICENSING BOARDS.
   37    (D)  NOTWITHSTANDING  ANY  OTHER  PROVISION  OF LAW, ALL PARTY STATES'
   38  LICENSING BOARDS CONTRIBUTING INFORMATION TO THE  COORDINATED  LICENSURE
   39  INFORMATION SYSTEM MAY DESIGNATE INFORMATION THAT MAY NOT BE SHARED WITH
   40  NON-PARTY  STATES  OR DISCLOSED TO OTHER ENTITIES OR INDIVIDUALS WITHOUT
   41  THE EXPRESS PERMISSION OF THE CONTRIBUTING STATE.
   42    (E) ANY  PERSONALLY  IDENTIFIABLE  INFORMATION  OBTAINED  BY  A  PARTY
   43  STATES'  LICENSING  BOARD  FROM  THE  COORDINATED  LICENSURE INFORMATION
   44  SYSTEM MAY NOT BE SHARED WITH NON-PARTY STATES  OR  DISCLOSED  TO  OTHER
   45  ENTITIES  OR  INDIVIDUALS  EXCEPT TO THE EXTENT PERMITTED BY THE LAWS OF
   46  THE PARTY STATE CONTRIBUTING THE INFORMATION.
   47    (F) ANY INFORMATION CONTRIBUTED TO THE COORDINATED LICENSURE  INFORMA-
   48  TION  SYSTEM THAT IS SUBSEQUENTLY REQUIRED TO BE EXPUNGED BY THE LAWS OF
   49  THE PARTY STATE CONTRIBUTING THAT INFORMATION, SHALL  ALSO  BE  EXPUNGED
   50  FROM THE COORDINATED LICENSURE INFORMATION SYSTEM.
   51    (G)  THE COMPACT ADMINISTRATORS, ACTING JOINTLY WITH EACH OTHER AND IN
   52  CONSULTATION WITH THE ADMINISTRATOR OF THE COORDINATED LICENSURE  INFOR-
   53  MATION  SYSTEM,  SHALL FORMULATE NECESSARY AND PROPER PROCEDURES FOR THE

       A. 1332                             8

    1  IDENTIFICATION,  COLLECTION  AND  EXCHANGE  OF  INFORMATION  UNDER  THIS
    2  COMPACT.

    3                                ARTICLE VIII.
    4            COMPACT ADMINISTRATION AND INTERCHANGE OF INFORMATION

    5    (A)  THE HEAD OF THE NURSE LICENSING BOARD, OR HIS OR HER DESIGNEE, OF
    6  EACH PARTY STATE SHALL BE THE ADMINISTRATOR OF THIS COMPACT FOR  HIS  OR
    7  HER STATE.
    8    (B) THE COMPACT ADMINISTRATOR OF EACH PARTY STATE SHALL FURNISH TO THE
    9  COMPACT  ADMINISTRATOR  OF  EACH  OTHER  PARTY STATE ANY INFORMATION AND
   10  DOCUMENTS INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, A UNIFORM DATA SET OF  INVESTI-
   11  GATIONS,  IDENTIFYING INFORMATION, LICENSURE DATA AND DISCLOSABLE ALTER-
   12  NATIVE PROGRAM PARTICIPATION  INFORMATION  TO  FACILITATE  THE  ADMINIS-
   13  TRATION OF THIS COMPACT.
   14    (C) COMPACT ADMINISTRATORS SHALL HAVE THE AUTHORITY TO DEVELOP UNIFORM
   15  RULES TO FACILITATE AND COORDINATE IMPLEMENTATION OF THIS COMPACT. THESE
   16  UNIFORM  RULES  SHALL  BE  ADOPTED  BY PARTY STATES, UNDER THE AUTHORITY
   17  INVESTED UNDER ARTICLE VI(D).

   18                                 ARTICLE IX.
   19                                  IMMUNITY

   20    NO PARTY STATE OR THE OFFICERS OR  EMPLOYEES  OR  AGENTS  OF  A  PARTY
   21  STATE'S NURSE LICENSING BOARD WHO ACTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PROVISIONS
   22  OF  THIS  COMPACT  SHALL  BE LIABLE ON ACCOUNT OF ANY ACT OR OMISSION IN
   23  GOOD FAITH WHILE ENGAGED IN THE PERFORMANCE OF THEIR DUTIES  UNDER  THIS
   24  COMPACT.  GOOD  FAITH  IN THIS ARTICLE SHALL NOT INCLUDE WILLFUL MISCON-
   25  DUCT, GROSS NEGLIGENCE OR RECKLESSNESS.

   26                                 ARTICLE X.
   27                 ENTRY INTO FORCE, WITHDRAWAL, AND AMENDMENT

   28    (A) THIS COMPACT SHALL ENTER INTO FORCE AND BECOME EFFECTIVE AS TO ANY
   29  STATE WHEN IT HAS BEEN ENACTED INTO THE LAWS OF THAT  STATE.  ANY  PARTY
   30  STATE MAY WITHDRAW FROM THIS COMPACT BY ENACTING A STATUTE REPEALING THE
   31  SAME,  BUT  NO  SUCH WITHDRAWAL SHALL TAKE EFFECT UNTIL SIX MONTHS AFTER
   32  THE WITHDRAWING STATE HAS GIVEN NOTICE OF THE WITHDRAWAL TO  THE  EXECU-
   33  TIVE HEADS OF ALL OTHER PARTY STATES.
   34    (B)  NO  WITHDRAWAL  SHALL AFFECT THE VALIDITY OR APPLICABILITY BY THE
   35  LICENSING BOARDS OF STATES REMAINING PARTY TO THE COMPACT OF ANY  REPORT
   36  OF ADVERSE ACTION OCCURRING PRIOR TO THE WITHDRAWAL.
   37    (C) NOTHING CONTAINED IN THIS COMPACT SHALL BE CONSTRUED TO INVALIDATE
   38  OR  PREVENT  ANY NURSE LICENSURE AGREEMENT OR OTHER COOPERATIVE ARRANGE-
   39  MENT BETWEEN A PARTY STATE AND A NON-PARTY STATE THAT IS MADE IN ACCORD-
   40  ANCE WITH THE OTHER PROVISIONS OF THIS COMPACT.
   41    (D) THIS COMPACT MAY BE AMENDED BY THE PARTY STATES. NO  AMENDMENT  TO
   42  THIS  COMPACT  SHALL  BECOME EFFECTIVE AND BINDING UPON THE PARTY STATES
   43  UNLESS AND UNTIL IT IS ENACTED INTO THE LAWS OF ALL PARTY STATES.

   44                                 ARTICLE XI.
   45                        CONSTRUCTION AND SEVERABILITY

   46    1. (A) THIS COMPACT SHALL BE LIBERALLY CONSTRUED SO AS  TO  EFFECTUATE
   47  THE  PURPOSES THEREOF. THE PROVISIONS OF THIS COMPACT SHALL BE SEVERABLE
   48  AND IF ANY PHRASE, CLAUSE, SENTENCE OR  PROVISION  OF  THIS  COMPACT  IS

       A. 1332                             9

    1  DECLARED TO BE CONTRARY TO THE CONSTITUTION OF ANY PARTY STATE OR OF THE
    2  UNITED  STATES  OR  THE APPLICABILITY THEREOF TO ANY GOVERNMENT, AGENCY,
    3  PERSON OR CIRCUMSTANCE IS HELD INVALID, THE VALIDITY OF THE REMAINDER OF
    4  THIS  COMPACT  AND  THE APPLICABILITY THEREOF TO ANY GOVERNMENT, AGENCY,
    5  PERSON OR CIRCUMSTANCE SHALL NOT BE AFFECTED THEREBY.  IF  THIS  COMPACT
    6  SHALL  BE  HELD CONTRARY TO THE CONSTITUTION OF ANY STATE PARTY THERETO,
    7  THE COMPACT SHALL REMAIN IN FULL FORCE AND EFFECT AS  TO  THE  REMAINING
    8  PARTY STATES AND IN FULL FORCE AND EFFECT AS TO THE PARTY STATE AFFECTED
    9  AS TO ALL SEVERABLE MATTERS.
   10    (B)  IN THE EVENT PARTY STATES FIND A NEED FOR SETTLING DISPUTES ARIS-
   11  ING UNDER THIS COMPACT:
   12    (1) THE PARTY STATES MAY SUBMIT THE ISSUES  IN  DISPUTE  TO  AN  ARBI-
   13  TRATION  PANEL WHICH WILL BE COMPRISED OF AN INDIVIDUAL APPOINTED BY THE
   14  COMPACT ADMINISTRATOR IN THE HOME STATE; AN INDIVIDUAL APPOINTED BY  THE
   15  COMPACT  ADMINISTRATOR  IN  THE  REMOTE STATE OR STATES INVOLVED; AND AN
   16  INDIVIDUAL MUTUALLY AGREED UPON BY THE COMPACT ADMINISTRATORS OF ALL THE
   17  PARTY STATES INVOLVED IN THE DISPUTE.
   18    (2) THE DECISION OF A MAJORITY OF THE ARBITRATORS SHALL BE  FINAL  AND
   19  BINDING.
   20    2.  FOR  THE  PURPOSES  OF THE COMPACT SET FORTH IN SUBDIVISION ONE OF
   21  THIS SECTION THE "HEAD OF THE NURSE  LICENSING  BOARD"  FOR  THIS  STATE
   22  SHALL BE THE SECRETARY TO THE STATE BOARD FOR NURSING.
   23    3.  TO  FACILITATE  CROSS-STATE  ENFORCEMENT EFFORTS, THIS STATE SHALL
   24  HAVE THE POWER TO RECOVER FROM THE AFFECTED NURSE THE COSTS OF  INVESTI-
   25  GATIONS AND DISPOSITION OF CASES RESULTING FROM ADVERSE ACTIONS TAKEN BY
   26  THIS STATE AGAINST THAT NURSE.
   27    4. THIS COMPACT IS DESIGNED TO FACILITATE THE REGULATION OF NURSES AND
   28  DOES  NOT  RELIEVE  EMPLOYERS FROM COMPLYING WITH OBLIGATIONS IMPOSED BY
   29  LAW OR REGULATION.
   30    5. THIS COMPACT DOES NOT SUPERSEDE EXISTING LABOR LAWS.
   31    6. TO FACILITATE WORKFORCE PLANNING, THE COMMISSIONER IS AUTHORIZED TO
   32  COLLECT EMPLOYMENT DATA ON NURSES PRACTICING ON THE  MULTI-PRIVILEGE  IN
   33  THE NURSE LICENSURE COMPACT PROVIDED THAT THE SUBMISSION OF THIS DATA IS
   34  NOT A REQUIREMENT FOR PRACTICE UNDER THE MULTI-STATE PRIVILEGE.
   35    S  2.  This  act shall take effect on the ninetieth day after it shall
   36  have become a law; provided, however, that  effective  immediately,  the
   37  addition,  amendment  and/or  repeal of any rule or regulation necessary
   38  for the implementation of this act on its effective date are  authorized
   39  and directed to be made and completed on or before such effective date.

   40                                   PART D

   41    Section 1. Section 6501 of the education law, as amended by chapter 81
   42  of the laws of 1995, is amended to read as follows:
   43    S  6501. Admission to a profession (licensing).  Admission to practice
   44  of a profession in this state is accomplished by a license being  issued
   45  to  a qualified applicant by the education department.  To qualify for a
   46  license an applicant shall meet the requirements prescribed in the arti-
   47  cle for the  particular  profession  and  shall  meet  the  requirements
   48  prescribed  in  section  3-503  of the general obligations law; PROVIDED
   49  THAT, NOTWITHSTANDING ANY PROVISION OF LAW TO THE CONTRARY,  ANY  APPLI-
   50  CANT  WHO  IS  THE  SPOUSE OF A MEMBER OF THE ARMED FORCES OF THE UNITED
   51  STATES, NATIONAL GUARD OR RESERVES MAY SUBMIT SATISFACTORY  EVIDENCE  OF
   52  LICENSURE  TO  PRACTICE  AN  EQUIVALENT  OCCUPATION  ISSUED BY ANY OTHER
   53  STATE, TERRITORY, PROTECTORATE OR DEPENDENCY OF  THE  UNITED  STATES  IN
   54  LIEU  OF THE SUBMISSIONS REQUIRED BY THE ARTICLE OF THIS CHAPTER FOR THE

       A. 1332                            10

    1  PARTICULAR PROFESSION, PROVIDED THAT SUCH LICENSE WAS GRANTED IN COMPLI-
    2  ANCE WITH STANDARDS WHICH WERE, IN THE JUDGMENT OF THE BOARD OF REGENTS,
    3  NOT LOWER THAN THOSE OF THIS STATE.
    4    S  2.  The general business law is amended by adding a new article 2-A
    5  to read as follows:
    6                                 ARTICLE 2-A
    7                          ADMISSION TO A PROFESSION
    8  SECTION 20. ADMISSION  TO  A  PROFESSION;  LICENSING,  CERTIFICATION  OR
    9                REGISTRATION.
   10    S 20. ADMISSION TO A PROFESSION; LICENSING, CERTIFICATION OR REGISTRA-
   11  TION.  ADMISSION TO PRACTICE OF A PROFESSION GOVERNED BY THIS CHAPTER IN
   12  THIS  STATE IS ACCOMPLISHED, WHERE REQUIRED, BY A LICENSE, CERTIFICATION
   13  OR CERTIFICATE OF REGISTRATION BEING ISSUED TO A QUALIFIED APPLICANT  BY
   14  THE  SECRETARY  OF  STATE.  TO  QUALIFY  FOR A LICENSE, CERTIFICATION OR
   15  CERTIFICATE OF REGISTRATION AN APPLICANT  SHALL  MEET  THE  REQUIREMENTS
   16  PRESCRIBED  IN  THE ARTICLE FOR THE PARTICULAR PROFESSION AND SHALL MEET
   17  THE REQUIREMENTS PRESCRIBED IN SECTION 3-503 OF THE GENERAL  OBLIGATIONS
   18  LAW;  PROVIDED  THAT,  NOTWITHSTANDING  ANY  PROVISION OF THE LAW TO THE
   19  CONTRARY, ANY APPLICANT WHO IS THE SPOUSE OF A MEMBER OF THE ARMED FORC-
   20  ES OF THE UNITED STATES, NATIONAL GUARD OR RESERVES MAY SUBMIT SATISFAC-
   21  TORY EVIDENCE OF LICENSURE, CERTIFICATION OR REGISTRATION TO PRACTICE AN
   22  EQUIVALENT OCCUPATION ISSUED BY ANY OTHER STATE, TERRITORY, PROTECTORATE
   23  OR DEPENDENCY OF THE UNITED STATES IN LIEU OF THE  SUBMISSIONS  REQUIRED
   24  BY  THE  ARTICLE OF THIS CHAPTER FOR THE PARTICULAR PROFESSION, PROVIDED
   25  THAT SUCH LICENSE, CERTIFICATION  OR  CERTIFICATE  OF  REGISTRATION  WAS
   26  GRANTED  IN COMPLIANCE WITH STANDARDS WHICH WERE, IN THE JUDGMENT OF THE
   27  SECRETARY, NOT LOWER THAN THOSE OF THIS STATE.
   28    S 3. Subsection (d) of section 2136 of the insurance law, as added  by
   29  chapter 687 of the laws of 2003, is amended to read as follows:
   30    (d)  (1)  the  applicant's  home  state  awards  nonresident insurance
   31  producer licenses to residents of  this  state  on  the  same  basis  as
   32  provided in this subsection; OR
   33    (2) THE APPLICANT IS THE SPOUSE OF A MEMBER OF THE ARMED FORCES OF THE
   34  UNITED STATES, NATIONAL GUARD OR RESERVES.
   35    S 4. Section 442-g of the real property law is amended by adding a new
   36  subdivision 1-a to read as follows:
   37    1-A.  NO  NONRESIDENT  APPLICANT  WHO IS THE SPOUSE OF A MEMBER OF THE
   38  ARMED FORCES OF THE UNITED STATES, NATIONAL GUARD, OR RESERVES REGULARLY
   39  ENGAGED IN THE REAL ESTATE BUSINESS AS A VOCATION, WHO MAINTAINS A DEFI-
   40  NITE PLACE OF BUSINESS AND IS LICENSED BY ANY  OTHER  STATE,  TERRITORY,
   41  PROTECTORATE  OR  DEPENDENCY  OF THE UNITED STATES, SHALL BE REQUIRED TO
   42  MAINTAIN A PLACE OF BUSINESS WITHIN THIS  STATE.  THE  COMMISSION  SHALL
   43  RECOGNIZE THE LICENSE ISSUED BY ANOTHER STATE TO AN APPLICANT WHO IS THE
   44  SPOUSE  OF  A  MEMBER OF THE ARMED FORCES OF THE UNITED STATES, NATIONAL
   45  GUARD, OR RESERVES AS QUALIFICATION FOR A LICENSE IN NEW YORK,  PROVIDED
   46  THAT  SUCH  LICENSE WAS GRANTED IN COMPLIANCE WITH STANDARDS WHICH WERE,
   47  IN THE JUDGMENT OF THE SECRETARY, NOT LOWER THAN THOSE OF THIS STATE.
   48    S 5. Section 444-e of the real property law is amended by adding a new
   49  subdivision 2-a to read as follows:
   50    2-A. ANY APPLICANT FOR A LICENSE WHO IS A SPOUSE OF A  MEMBER  OF  THE
   51  ARMED FORCES OF THE UNITED STATES, NATIONAL GUARD OR RESERVES MAY SUBMIT
   52  SATISFACTORY  EVIDENCE OF LICENSURE TO PRACTICE AN EQUIVALENT OCCUPATION
   53  ISSUED BY ANY OTHER STATE, TERRITORY, PROTECTORATE OR DEPENDENCY OF  THE
   54  UNITED STATES IN LIEU OF THE EVIDENCE OF EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE AND EXAM-
   55  INATION  REQUIRED BY SUBDIVISION ONE OF THIS SECTION, PROVIDED THAT SUCH

       A. 1332                            11

    1  LICENSE WAS GRANTED IN COMPLIANCE WITH  STANDARDS  WHICH  WERE,  IN  THE
    2  JUDGMENT OF THE SECRETARY, NOT LOWER THAN THOSE OF THIS STATE.
    3    S  6.  This  act shall take effect on the ninetieth day after it shall
    4  have become a law; provided, however, that  effective  immediately,  the
    5  addition,  amendment  and/or  repeal of any rule or regulation necessary
    6  for the implementation of this act on its effective date are  authorized
    7  and directed to be made and completed on or before such effective date.
    8    S 2. Severability clause. If any clause, sentence, paragraph, subdivi-
    9  sion,  section  or  part  of  this act shall be adjudged by any court of
   10  competent jurisdiction to be invalid, such judgment  shall  not  affect,
   11  impair,  or  invalidate  the remainder thereof, but shall be confined in
   12  its operation to the clause, sentence, paragraph,  subdivision,  section
   13  or part thereof directly involved in the controversy in which such judg-
   14  ment shall have been rendered. It is hereby declared to be the intent of
   15  the  legislature  that  this  act  would  have been enacted even if such
   16  invalid provisions had not been included herein.
   17    S 3. This act shall take effect immediately; provided,  however,  that
   18  the  applicable effective date of Parts A through D of this act shall be
   19  as specifically set forth in the last section of such Parts.
actClause: AN ACT to require a workgroup to investigate and report about licensing and the difficulties encountered by military spouses (Part A); to amend the education law, in relation to the authority of the state to certify persons to teach who are not graduates of teacher education programs (Part B); to amend the education law, in relation to adopting the interstate nursing licensure compact (Part C); to amend the education law, the general business law, the insurance law and the real property law, in relation to licensing of military spouses with out-of-state licenses in equivalent occupations (Part D)
